name: preceptor
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a teacher, or someone who trains people how to do a job: He was appointed acting director of studies and preceptor in anatomy at Corpus Christi College, Cambridge, in 2012. We all learn different techniques from our preceptors during training.
More examplesFewer examplesShe is a faculty preceptor for Nova Southeastern University. In some respects, we who are their teachers or preceptors are at fault. The name of Ammonius, his teacher and preceptor at Athens, occurs repeatedly in the minor works.
